mercury.name: Mercury
mercury.atmosphere: Extremely thin, mostly oxygen, sodium, hydrogen
facts: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system
It has the most extreme temperature variations of any planet
One day on Mercury lasts about 59 Earth days
Mercury has no atmosphere to trap heat
It orbits the Sun faster than any other planet

venus.name: Venus
venus.atmosphere: Dense, mostly carbon dioxide with sulfuric acid clouds
facts: Venus rotates backwards compared to most planets
It's the hottest planet in our solar system
A day on Venus is longer than its year
Venus is often called Earth's twin due to similar size
It rains sulfuric acid on Venus

earth.name: Earth
facts: Earth is the only known planet with life
About 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water
Earth has the strongest magnetic field of the terrestrial planets
Our planet is about 4.5 billion years old
Earth's core is as hot as the Sun's surface

mars.name: Mars
facts: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface
It has the largest volcano in the solar system (Olympus Mons)
Mars has polar ice caps made of water and carbon dioxide
A day on Mars is very similar to a day on Earth
Mars has two small moons: Phobos and Deimos

jupiter.name: Jupiter
facts: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system
It has the Great Red Spot, a storm larger than Earth
Jupiter acts as a cosmic vacuum cleaner, protecting inner planets
It has at least 95 known moons including the four largest: Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto
Jupiter could fit all other planets inside it

saturn.name: Saturn
facts: Saturn is famous for its spectacular ring system
It's less dense than water and would float if placed in a giant bathtub
Saturn has 146 confirmed moons, including Titan which is larger than Mercury
Its rings are made mostly of ice particles and rocky debris
Saturn's moon Enceladus has geysers shooting ice into space

uranus.name: Uranus
facts: Uranus rotates on its side at a 98-degree angle
Uranus is one of the coldest planets in our solar system
Uranus has faint rings that were discovered in 1977
A year on Uranus equals 84 Earth years
It rains diamonds on Uranus due to extreme pressure

neptune.name: Neptune
facts: Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system, up to 1,200 mph
It was the first planet discovered through mathematical prediction
Neptune takes 165 Earth years to orbit the Sun once
Its largest moon, Triton, orbits backward
Neptune appears blue due to methane in its atmosphere
